answers.answer: I thought you did not get test until 24 to 28 weeks or something like that?
They did my blood tests at 13 weeks I guess they said my blood sugar was too high

i had gestational diabetes with all 3 of my pregnancies, and i found it quite hard when sugar cravings kicked in! I had to use an artificial sweetener for in my cups of tea, or in anything that required sugar. i also stayed away from white bread, biscuits, potatoes, basically all junk food! Good things to snack on were diet yogurts, and anything protein. I found that if i was really hungry i would make an omelette to fill me up and it wouldn't affect my glucose levels. I was able to diet control mine, so never ended up on insulin.

Yep with my two pregnancies started at 30 weeks but this time started really early two weeks :/ so yeh I'm in insulin & getting baby  monitor twice a week in the hospital no fun to be diabetic! But try to cut your sugar u don't want to have big baby it's super heavy & it's dangerous coz the fluid might get high

I'm 20 weeks and was also diagnosed with diabetes the other day. But my doctor whet ahead and put my on pills...  2nd pregnancy and never in my life has had health problems...  so it has me a Tad bit spooked..  but im going to do my best to eat right...  that's all I can can do.. I don't have sugar cravings,  I've lost 13pounds, and my sugar was still high.. :(

question: I'm 14 weeks and just found out I have gestational diabetes...just wondering if anyone has any experience with this and any advice?
title: gestational diabetes anyone have any experience?
